definition: to do things in bits and pieces (idiom); piecemeal work

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)

sentences.english: Let's settle the matter at one stroke, not piecemeal.
sentences.chinese: 把这事一气儿解决了吧，别零敲碎打了。

sentences.english: Let's do this at one go, not scattergun!
sentences.chinese: 咱们一起把这事解决了，别零敲碎打了。

sentences.english: You can't do reform in a piecemeal process, " he said."
sentences.chinese: “你不能做改革的零敲碎打的过程中，”他说。

definition: to do things in bits and pieces (idiom); piecemeal work
to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
banging away clumsily in all directions with no overall vision

definition: dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to lead/to be in front
to work vaguely then retreat (idiom); sloppy and half-hearted/half-baked
lit. the guest acts as host (idiom); fig. to turn from passive to active behavior
to remedy omissions and correct errors (idiom)
to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
